017package org.apache.juneau.json;
018
019import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.Utils.*;
020
021import java.lang.annotation.*;
022import java.nio.charset.*;
023import java.util.*;
024import java.util.concurrent.*;
025
026import org.apache.juneau.*;
027import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
028import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
029import org.apache.juneau.parser.*;
030import org.apache.juneau.utils.*;
031
032/**
033 * Parses any valid JSON text into a POJO model.
034 *
035 * <h5 class='topic'>Media types</h5>
036 * <p>
037 * Handles <c>Content-Type</c> types:  <bc>application/json, text/json</bc>
038 *
039 * <h5 class='topic'>Description</h5>
040 * <p>
041 * This parser uses a state machine, which makes it very fast and efficient.  It parses JSON in about 70% of the
042 * time that it takes the built-in Java DOM parsers to parse equivalent XML.
043 *
044 * <p>
045 * This parser handles all valid JSON syntax.
046 * In addition, when strict mode is disable, the parser also handles the following:
047 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
048 *    <li>
049 *       Javascript comments (both {@code /*} and {@code //}) are ignored.
050 *    <li>
051 *       Both single and double quoted strings.
052 *    <li>
053 *       Automatically joins concatenated strings (e.g. <code><js>"aaa"</js> + <js>'bbb'</js></code>).
054 *    <li>
055 *       Unquoted attributes and values.
056 * </ul>
057 *
058 * <p>
059 * Also handles negative, decimal, hexadecimal, octal, and double numbers, including exponential notation.
060 *
061 * <p>
062 * This parser handles the following input, and automatically returns the corresponding Java class.
063 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
064 *    <li>
065 *       JSON objects (<js>"{...}"</js>) are converted to {@link JsonMap JsonMaps}.
066 *       <b>Note:</b>  If a <code><xa>_type</xa>=<xs>'xxx'</xs></code> attribute is specified on the object, then an
067 *       attempt is made to convert the object to an instance of the specified Java bean class.
068 *       See the {@link org.apache.juneau.BeanContext.Builder#typePropertyName(String)} setting for more information about parsing
069 *       beans from JSON.
070 *    <li>
071 *       JSON arrays (<js>"[...]"</js>) are converted to {@link JsonList JsonLists}.
072 *    <li>
073 *       JSON string literals (<js>"'xyz'"</js>) are converted to {@link String Strings}.
074 *    <li>
075 *       JSON numbers (<js>"123"</js>, including octal/hexadecimal/exponential notation) are converted to
076 *       {@link Integer Integers}, {@link Long Longs}, {@link Float Floats}, or {@link Double Doubles} depending on
077 *       whether the number is decimal, and the size of the number.
078 *    <li>
079 *       JSON booleans (<js>"false"</js>) are converted to {@link Boolean Booleans}.
080 *    <li>
081 *       JSON nulls (<js>"null"</js>) are converted to <jk>null</jk>.
082 *    <li>
083 *       Input consisting of only whitespace or JSON comments are converted to <jk>null</jk>.
084 * </ul>
085 *
086 * <p>
087 * Input can be any of the following:
088 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
089 *    <li>
090 *       <js>"{...}"</js> - Converted to an {@link JsonMap} or an instance of a Java bean if a <xa>_type</xa>
091 *       attribute is present.
092 *    <li>
093 *       <js>"[...]"</js> - Converted to an {@link JsonList}.
094 *    <li>
095 *       <js>"123..."</js> - Converted to a {@link Number} (either {@link Integer}, {@link Long}, {@link Float},
096 *       or {@link Double}).
097 *    <li>
098 *       <js>"true"</js>/<js>"false"</js> - Converted to a {@link Boolean}.
099 *    <li>
100 *       <js>"null"</js> - Returns <jk>null</jk>.
101 *    <li>
102 *       <js>"'xxx'"</js> - Converted to a {@link String}.
103 *    <li>
104 *       <js>"\"xxx\""</js> - Converted to a {@link String}.
105 *    <li>
106 *       <js>"'xxx' + \"yyy\""</js> - Converted to a concatenated {@link String}.
107 * </ul>
108 *
109 * <p>
110 * TIP:  If you know you're parsing a JSON object or array, it can be easier to parse it using the
111 * {@link JsonMap#JsonMap(CharSequence) JsonMap(CharSequence)} or {@link JsonList#JsonList(CharSequence)
112 * JsonList(CharSequence)} constructors instead of using this class.
113 * The end result should be the same.
114 *
115 * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
116 *    <li class='note'>This class is thread safe and reusable.
117 * </ul>
118 *
119 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
120 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JsonBasics">JSON Basics</a>
121
122 * </ul>
123 */
124public class JsonParser extends ReaderParser implements JsonMetaProvider {
125
126   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
127   // Static
128   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
129
130   /** Default parser, all default settings.*/
131   public static final JsonParser DEFAULT = new JsonParser(create());
132
133   /** Default parser, all default settings.*/
134   public static final JsonParser DEFAULT_STRICT = new JsonParser.Strict(create());
135
136   /**
137    * Creates a new builder for this object.
138    *
139    * @return A new builder.
140    */
141   public static Builder create() {
142      return new Builder();
143   }
144
145   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
146   // Static subclasses
147   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
148
149   /** Default parser, strict mode. */
150   public static class Strict extends JsonParser {
151
152      /**
153       * Constructor.
154       *
155       * @param builder The builder for this object.
156       */
157      public Strict(Builder builder) {
158         super(builder.strict().validateEnd());
159      }
160   }
161
162   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
163   // Builder
164   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
165
166   /**
167    * Builder class.
168    */
169   @FluentSetters
170   public static class Builder extends ReaderParser.Builder {
171
172      private static final Cache<HashKey,JsonParser> CACHE = Cache.of(HashKey.class, JsonParser.class).build();
173
174      boolean validateEnd;
175
176      /**
177       * Constructor, default settings.
178       */
179      protected Builder() {
180         consumes("application/json,text/json");
181         validateEnd = env("JsonParser.validateEnd", false);
182      }
183
184      /**
185       * Copy constructor.
186       *
187       * @param copyFrom The bean to copy from.
188       */
189      protected Builder(JsonParser copyFrom) {
190         super(copyFrom);
191         validateEnd = copyFrom.validateEnd;
192      }
193
194      /**
195       * Copy constructor.
196       *
197       * @param copyFrom The builder to copy from.
198       */
199      protected Builder(Builder copyFrom) {
200         super(copyFrom);
201         validateEnd = copyFrom.validateEnd;
202      }
203
204      @Override /* Context.Builder */
205      public Builder copy() {
206         return new Builder(this);
207      }
208
209      @Override /* Context.Builder */
210      public JsonParser build() {
211         return cache(CACHE).build(JsonParser.class);
212      }
213
214      @Override /* Context.Builder */
215      public HashKey hashKey() {
216         return HashKey.of(
217            super.hashKey(),
218            validateEnd
219         );
220      }
221
222      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
223      // Properties
224      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
225
226      /**
227       * Validate end.
228       *
229       * <p>
230       * When enabled, after parsing a POJO from the input, verifies that the remaining input in
231       * the stream consists of only comments or whitespace.
232       *
233       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
234       * <p class='bjava'>
235       *    <jc>// Create a parser that validates that there's no garbage at the end of the input.</jc>
236       *    ReaderParser <jv>parser</jv> = JsonParser.
237       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
238       *       .validateEnd()
239       *       .build();
240       *
241       *    <jc>// Should fail because input has multiple POJOs.</jc>
242       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <js>"{foo:'bar'}{baz:'qux'}"</js>;
243       *    MyBean <jv>myBean</jv> =<jv>parser</jv>.parse(<jv>json</jv>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
244       * </p>
245       *
246       * @return This object.
247       */
248      @FluentSetter
249      public Builder validateEnd() {
250         return validateEnd(true);
251      }
252
253      /**
254       * Same as {@link #validateEnd()} but allows you to explicitly specify the value.
255       *
256       * @param value The value for this setting.
257       * @return This object.
258       */
259      @FluentSetter
260      public Builder validateEnd(boolean value) {
261         validateEnd = value;
262         return this;
263      }
264
265      // <FluentSetters>
266

711      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.parser.Parser.Builder */
712      public Builder listener(Class<? extends org.apache.juneau.parser.ParserListener> value) {
713         super.listener(value);
714         return this;
715      }

767
768   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
769   // Instance
770   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
771
772   final boolean validateEnd;
773
774   private final Map<ClassMeta<?>,JsonClassMeta> jsonClassMetas = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
775   private final Map<BeanPropertyMeta,JsonBeanPropertyMeta> jsonBeanPropertyMetas = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
776
777   /**
778    * Constructor.
779    *
780    * @param builder The builder for this object.
781    */
782   public JsonParser(Builder builder) {
783      super(builder);
784      validateEnd = builder.validateEnd;
785   }
786
787   @Override /* Context */
788   public Builder copy() {
789      return new Builder(this);
790   }
791
792   @Override /* Context */
793   public JsonParserSession.Builder createSession() {
794      return JsonParserSession.create(this);
795   }
796
797   @Override /* Context */
798   public JsonParserSession getSession() {
799      return createSession().build();
800   }
801
802   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
803   // Extended metadata
804   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
805
806   @Override /* JsonMetaProvider */
807   public JsonClassMeta getJsonClassMeta(ClassMeta<?> cm) {
808      JsonClassMeta m = jsonClassMetas.get(cm);
809      if (m == null) {
810         m = new JsonClassMeta(cm, this);
811         jsonClassMetas.put(cm, m);
812      }
813      return m;
814   }
815
816   @Override /* JsonMetaProvider */
817   public JsonBeanPropertyMeta getJsonBeanPropertyMeta(BeanPropertyMeta bpm) {
818      if (bpm == null)
819         return JsonBeanPropertyMeta.DEFAULT;
820      JsonBeanPropertyMeta m = jsonBeanPropertyMetas.get(bpm);
821      if (m == null) {
822         m = new JsonBeanPropertyMeta(bpm.getDelegateFor(), this);
823         jsonBeanPropertyMetas.put(bpm, m);
824      }
825      return m;
826   }
827
828   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
829   // Properties
830   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
831
832   /**
833    * Validate end.
834    *
835    * @see Builder#validateEnd()
836    * @return
837    *    <jk>true</jk> if after parsing a POJO from the input, verifies that the remaining input in
838    *    the stream consists of only comments or whitespace.
839    */
840   protected final boolean isValidateEnd() {
841      return validateEnd;
842   }
843}
